title: SS.PT.407
prompt: According to the passage, for what aspect of a nuclear bomb attack did the government conclude there was no defense?
description: The passage describes the measures taken to develop and popularize civil defense procedures during the height of the cold war. The photograph shows a basement family fallout shelter, 1957.
feedback: The passage says clearly that "of the two outcomes of a nuclear explosion, firestorm and fallout," defending against fallout "had the only real possibility of success." The passage mentions neither "U.S. retaliation" nor "apathy on the part of citizens."
